results.firPara: Dier the dependable, Costa can be a real threat for Spain, Gabriel Jesus gives Neymar some backing and Snodgrass proves worth for Scotland
results.secPara: Eric Dier was one of the few England players to escape the post-Iceland wreckage without scathing criticism, yet he was also quick to put his hands up and admit it will be a long time before the scars are healed. He sounded genuinely apologetic about the disaster in France after the far from perfect win in Slovakia on Sunday, which must be welcomed. There is a long way to go until the scars have been healed but it is a start, he said. All we can do is win against whoever we have in front of us but I think there is a long way to go before we repay everyone for what happened in the Euros. Yet Dier also deserves praise for his performances. There is a growing argument that the Tottenham Hotspur midfielder has been Englands best player in 2016, doing much of the thankless dirty work that passes by unnoticed. And in Trnava on Sunday evening he was as dependable as usual. Nobody touched or passed the ball more and with plenty of questions over the composition of Sam Allardyces midfield in the future, Dier must be the only certain starter. AS
results.webTitle: World Cup 2018 qualifiers: 10 talking points from the first set of games

results.firPara: Todays tell-all is thin on the ground

results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Eddie Howe to replace Arsène Wenger at Arsenal?

results.firPara: By now you have probably heard the story that has been doing the rounds in the past few days about Brian Clough, drunk as a skunk apparently, trying to sign Dean Saunders for Nottingham Forest for what would have been a British record transfer fee.
results.secPara: Some belting lines, too, if you like the idea there was a time when the best managers in the business refused to dance to the tune of agents. Clough never had time for middle men (Peter Shilton tells a wonderful story about taking two of his advisers into transfer negotiations and Clough waiting behind his office door to trip them up with a squash racket) and was clearly put out to find Saunders, then at Derby County, had brought one with him.
results.webTitle: Dean Saunders and Brian Clough – a story that went viral but doesn’t finish there | Daniel Taylor

results.firPara: A starlet and a veteran excelled in attack as the US surged into the final Concacaf qualifying round for the 2018 World Cup.
results.secPara: As exciting as it was to see Christian Pulisic underline his promise with a productive display in his first international start, the Americans will also be encouraged by Jozy Altidores two-goal showing.
results.webTitle: Altidore and Pulisic excel as USA clinch spot in the Hex with easy win over T&T

results.firPara: The Barcelona midfielder opens up about the time, before the 2010 World Cup, when he stopped feeling like a footballer and had to seek professional hel
results.secPara: Andrés Iniesta says he heard the silence and knew that all he had to do was wait for Isaac Newton. The ball sat up; gravity would bring it down again and, when it did, he would score. It was the 116th minute in Johannesburg and he did score, running to the corner and pulling off his shirt to reveal the message underneath, written in blue marker by Hugo the kit man Dani Jarque, always with us. Ten thousand miles away Spain erupted and Jessica cried. Through the tears she saw it Dani, her Dani.
results.webTitle: Barcelona’s Andrés Iniesta: ‘I was a victim of something that terrified me’

results.firPara: Pep Guardiola faces a selection problem for Saturdays Manchester derby because Ilkay Gündogan is fit for selection while Nicolás Otamendi is not expected back from international duty with Argentina until late on Thursday.
results.secPara: Gündogan has been sidelined with a knee problem since Guardiola made him his first signing in early July but the midfielder has been in full training for over a fortnight and is available. City have won all three matches in the Premier League without him and Guardiola must decide if the 25-year-old, signed for around £20m from Borussia Dortmund, should be given his debut in a derby at Old Trafford.
results.webTitle: Pep Guardiola faces Manchester derby dilemma over Ilkay Gündogan
